segments.text: I see the woman at the sink, almost like a statue absorbed in her task.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her focus on the plate she is polishing makes her oblivious to the spill at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s peculiar how she can’t sense the impending chaos behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy, climbing on that unsteady stool, seems to be in a world of his own.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His excitement is contagious; I find myself holding my breath.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: What if he falls and the dishes break? What if he gets hurt?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl beside him is a picture of anticipation, extending her hand for a treat.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but admire their audacity; it’s the spirit of childhood.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But watching them, I feel a tingle of panic creeping in.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water continues to pour, unnoticed, creating a slick hazard beneath them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish the woman would just turn around to see the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Outside, the garden looks lovely, so serene compared to the commotion inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can hear birds chirping; their sounds are so out of place in this moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I’m caught between two worlds, one of calm and one of chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This moment is so fragile, it can break at any time.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I find myself rooting for the kids, yet fearing for their safety.
segments.speaker: PAR
